body: Quietly, and in advance of looming spending cuts, Immigration & Customs Enforcement begins to release "several hundred" detainees from federal immigrant detention centers across the country. (L.A. Times)
title: ICE begins releasing immigrant detainees
caption: An Orange County Sheriff's deputy keeps a watch over a group of immigration detainees in the medical and dental care area at the Theo Lacy Facility in Orange, Calif.

title: ICE announces detainee release
caption: U.S. Department of Homeland Security Secretary Janet Napolitano speaks at the White House about the impact of possible sequestration cuts.

body: Sometime before midnight, President Obama will issue a sequestration order. At that point, Congress will be notified by the Office of Management and Budget, and federal agencies will activate their reduced-funding operation plans.  Cuts could begin immediately. Nothing short of aborting the entire sequester plan or striking a behemoth deficit deal will stop this.
title: Sequester deadline
caption: Speaker of the House John Boehner (R-OH) answers reporters' questions during a news conference.

body: Government agencies must give a month notice for furloughs. Employees will be able to find out about a furlough from this date on. (ABC News)
title: Furlough notices may be issued

body: By state law, school districts must send layoff notices for the following school year to certified employees by this date. (OC Register)
title: School district layoff notice deadline
caption: School districts may lose federal funding for teachers.

body: Furlough proposal notices will start being served to 64,000 civilian defense workers in California, according to Pentagon spokeswoman Army Lt. Col Elizabeth Robbins. Notices will be served through Mar. 25. Under the plan, furloughs would begin in late April, and almost all would be furloughed one day per week, through the end of September. (KPCC)
title: 64,000 California civilian defense workers considered for furlough
caption: Civilian defense workers face possible furloughs.

body: If a congressional deal is not reached, the government will run out of money. (ABC)
title: Deadline for a deal

body: Furlough decision letters will start being served to 64,000 civilian defense workers in California. (KPCC)
title: 64,000 California civilian defense workers begin receiving furlough decision letters

body: Furloughs, if they have been issued on March 4, may begin on this date.  (ABC News)
title: Furloughs may begin

body: Tax filing season will not be affected by possible furloughs, announced Acting Commisioner Steven T. Miller of the Internal Revenue Service. Furlough notices, however, are expected to come after. (Washington Post)
title: Taxes are still due
caption: Tax deadline will not change.

body: Congressional leaders will not be paid until they approve a budget for 2014. (Govexec.com)
title: Congressional pay at risk

body: Furlough would begin for an unspecified number of California civilian defense workers, one day per week, through the end of September. (KPCC)
title: Furlough begins for up to 64,000 California civilian defense workers

body: This would be the end date for a temporary suspension of the debt ceiling under "No Budget, No Pay." (Govexec.com)
title: Debt ceiling reprieve ends
caption: The debt ceiling reprieve will end.

body: The manner in which California school districts budget their money means that cuts (that would go into effect under sequestration on Mar. 1) would not be felt by districts until this day, the start of their new fiscal year. (Inland Valley News)
title: School districts begin budgeting for the next school year
